title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1625-6.3 - Applications' pending files
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1625-6.3 - Applications' pending files

State Regulations

The applications' pending files, whether active or
inactive should be maintained as close as possible to the tenant files. The
active files will consist of those applications determined to be eligible or
still being investigated and will be maintained in chronological order, with
earliest date on top, within category of size apartment needed. Active files
should be reviewed at least once a year to determine which applications should
be shifted to the inactive files. Form letters to applicants may be used for
such determination. Inactive files contain those applications which have been
determined to be ineligible or those that have since requested the withdrawal
of their applications. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
§§
1625-6.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
